intro: Lepidium virginicum var. pinnatisectum, commonly known as the pinnatisect wildcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in moist soils along streambanks and wetlands, exhibiting a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are finely divided, giving it a feathery appearance, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. This variant is distinguished by its pinnatisect leaf structure, which sets it apart from other lepidium species.
